markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Jyoti](/Monsters.aspx?ID=708)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Jyotis are sometimes called “false phoenixes” (a term they find insulting) by the ignorant or willful. These avian humanoids are native to the [Positive Energy Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=3). They rarely leave this enigmatic realm and view visitors from other planes as stains on the purity of their home. Jyotis particularly distrust divine spellcasters and religious warriors, seeing them as inclined to take credit for manifesting a life force that, from the jyotis' perspective, is as plentiful and ubiquitous as water is to fish.

 Despite their distrust of intruders, jyotis rarely attack unprovoked when their homes are not threatened. They are intolerant, however, of those who intrude on the palaces of crystallized light and captured flame in which they dwell. They often chase even those who come bearing gifts away; few visitors have anything they desire, for what they desire most is to be left alone. The jyotis' full wrath is reserved for natives of the [Shadow Plane](/Equipment.aspx?ID=288) and the [Negative Energy Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=2). Historically, the promise of battle with the gargoyle-like [sceaduinars](/Monsters.aspx?ID=794), whom they consider it their duty to oppose, has been the only thing to lure jyoti armies beyond the Positive Energy Plane.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 26

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Jyoti.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 9">[Jyoti](/Monsters.aspx?ID=708)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
<trait label="Positive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=128" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 153 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Jyoti](/Languages.aspx?ID=60)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +20, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +18, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +20, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +18

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +5

**Con** +4

**Int** +5

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Items**
_+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [longspear](/Weapons.aspx?ID=6)_

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 28 

**Fort** +15 

**Ref** +18 

**Will** +21 

+1 status to all saves vs. magic (+2 vs. divine magic)
</row>

**HP** 155

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)

**Resistances**
fire 10, negative 10

**Positive Energy Affinity** Positive [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89) effects always heal the jyoti for the maximum amount. It doesn't gain the automatic Hit Points or temporary Hit Points from being on a plane with the positive planar essence.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, fly 60 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_[flaming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=295) [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) longspear_ +20 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+6 piercing plus 1d6 fire

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
beak +21 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 2d12+6 piercing plus 1d6 fire

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
talon +21 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 2d8+6 slashing plus 1d6 fire

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 28, attack +20
- **Cantrips (5th)**
[Disrupt Undead](/Spells.aspx?ID=79), [Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=171)
- **2nd**
[Restoration](/Spells.aspx?ID=258) (×3)
- **3rd**
[Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) (×3)
- **4th**
[Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148), [Searing Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=269)
- **5th**
[Banishment](/Spells.aspx?ID=19), [Breath of Life](/Spells.aspx?ID=29)

**Breath Weapon**  ([Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The jyoti breathes a blast of searing flame infused with positive energy in a 40-foot cone that deals 8d6 fire damage plus 4d6 positive damage to creatures in the area (DC 28 basic Reflex save). The jyoti can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds.

**Infuse Weapons**  ([Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) Any weapon a jyoti wields becomes a _[flaming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=295) [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297)_ weapon while the jyoti holds it.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Crystal Vaults</title>

Jyoti make ideal guardians for artifacts too dangerous to be left where those hungry for power might seize them. Only they know what items of myth and legend, long thought lost or destroyed, lie within their crystal vaults. They are unreliable guardians of religious artifacts, however, which usually disgust them.
</aside>
name: Jyoti
